name: bulgarian.vim
description:
A phonetic bulgarian cyrillic keymap (UTF-8)

This phonetic map is quite similar to the way the Gtk cyrillic input module works: for your convenience, some symbols can be entered in different ways; for instance, to enter the "shcha" you can type "sj" (as in the gtk module) or "sht".
install_details:
Just copy the file to $VIM/vimfiles/keymap; to enter cyrillic mode, issue the command:
:set keymap=bulgarian
